intro: Ancistrotropis serrana, commonly known as the serrated sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant features small, serrated leaves and produces clusters of pink or purple flowers. It is adapted to arid environments and is often found in coastal dunes or rocky habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
